<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_BSP_ConsoleSetMode_Impl:
```c
void OS_BSP_ConsoleSetMode_Impl(uint32 ModeBits)
{
    char param[32];

    if (OS_BSP_GenericLinuxGlobal.EnableTermControl)
    {
        if (ModeBits == OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_NORMAL)
        {
            OS_BSP_ExecTput("sgr0", NULL);
        }
        else
        {
            if ((ModeBits & OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_HIGHLIGHT) == 0)
            {
                /* no highlight (standout) text */
                OS_BSP_ExecTput("rmso", NULL);
            }
            else
            {
                /* set highlight (standout) text */
                OS_BSP_ExecTput("smso", NULL);
            }

            snprintf(param, sizeof(param), "%d", OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_TO_ANSICOLOR(ModeBits));
            OS_BSP_ExecTput("setaf", param);
        }
    }
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
char param[32];
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.17 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation of MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 in the shown fragment. Rule 21.17 applies to the string functions from <string.h> (e.g. strcpy, strncpy, strcat, memcpy, memcpy, memset, memcmp, strlen, strncat, strspn). The fragment only defines a local buffer (char param[32]) and the code shown uses snprintf (from <stdio.h>), not any <string.h> functions. Therefore this fragment does not violate Rule 21.17. Potential violation scenario: if elsewhere param is used as the destination for a <string.h> function call (for example strcpy(param, long_string) or memcpy(param, src, len)) where the source length >= 32 (not leaving room for the terminating NUL for string functions), that would violate Rule 21.17 by causing accesses beyond the bounds of param.
